title: ESA’s ExoMars plans depend on NASA contributions
summary: While the European Space Agency has secured funding to continue the ExoMars mission for a 2028 launch, that plan requires cooperation with NASA that has yet to be finalized.

title: Artemis 1 mission reaches halfway point
summary: As the Artemis 1 mission reaches the halfway mark, NASA managers are adding additional test objectives for the Orion spacecraft to prepare for the vehicle’s first crewed flight.

title: Demonstration of new layer of missile-warning satellites planned for 2026
summary: The U.S. Space Systems Command announced Nov. 28 that two satellite designs — one by Millennium Space Systems and the other by Raytheon Intelligence & Space — passed critical reviews and will move into the next phase of development.

title: We’ve reached the end of a bizarre Atlantic hurricane season
summary: This was the rare year when there were no August storms. Then things blew up.

title: China outlines pathway for lunar and deep space exploration
summary: China has laid out its pathway for robotic and crewed lunar and deep space exploration, with a number of missions building towards a permanent moon base.
